docs.snippet: New Jersey's director of consumer health services says another death from botulism, such as the one that occurred last June in Westchester, "absolutely" could happen again....
docs.lead_paragraph: New Jersey's director of consumer health services says another death from botulism, such as the one that occurred last June in Westchester, "absolutely" could happen again.
docs.abstract: NJ Health Services Dir Dr Sussman says additional fatalities from botulism, similar to those that occurred in June '71, are 'absolutely' possible since State Health Dept is understaffed and underfinanced to degree that inhibits adequate job of policing food production, int; says problem is not unique to NJ, but has assumed nationwide prominence as result of 'down-grading' of food inspection programs from Fed to local level; problem in NYS, NJ and Conn discussed; testing for botulism at Fed lab illus
